Title:  Ausfahrt freihalten.

#Xberg #wrangelkiez #naturalAntiGentrification #BerlinLovesYou

I am wondering what these businesses did before. 

Also, there is so much and also FREE quality information about professional prompting out there.
Well, stupid people will do stupid things, what should I say @@4176802 😄

True about the general public who created the hype and false beliefs. Though I see it going somewhere since I personally experienced great benefits like realizing personal projects I would not have the manpower to do them. But yes, it needs a big warning sticker, like giving 🔥 to Neandertals.

If you are green to a topic, don't use it or with extra care, it's that simple. There are AI tools, which gives you the sources with any generated answer. And when you read sth. in the internet from an unknown source, you also have to validate that info. Plus AI can summarize, simplify and inspire.
I agree @@958100, just discovered claude a couple of days ago, which I could use by Poe here in Europe.
As said before, you must be aware of the AI hype and the output. Know how to use it. I get a lot of value and ideas out of it.
Yep, you must be aware of the hype and the output. Know how to use it. I get a lot of value and ideas out of it.
https://www.businessinsider.de/karriere/kuenstliche-intelligenz-wird-mehr-jobs-schaffen-als-vernichten-analyse-deutsche-bank/

Actually not @@137859.
Here is an article in German, but you find a graph about unemployment vs tech. revolutions. Link comes in the next response.

Agree to AI being overhyped, and ofc tech is not good b/c it's new. I focus solely on HOW it CAN actually benefit us.
Amen.

The main idea of this whole thread is about the technology. I am not praising for big tech, read properly.

"They are actively trying to destroy jobs & livelihoods with automation ..."
Aha. So what happened after the other 3 industrial revolutions? If you want to become a Luddit, it's your choice.
The very same reason why they care in the first place.
Exactly @@527952 . 🎯
No generalization please. Black sheeps and scammer are everywhere, wherever you look.

There we go. I am a ex developer now copywriter for a decade and also say it's already 70% overall. First seen as a threat, but now understanding the importance of the human element, final touch and ofc fact checking and experience you bring in.

I agree to all of that. It's the early stage, it can't fly properly yet, so we have to keep failing forward. It's good to raise the awareness that it's not working properly amongst people who do not see or avoid to see that. But eventually it will fly smooth in most areas.

"AI models aren't designed to share valid or correct information". 
The masses aside, why are smart people using it? Is the entire tech world gone crazy pouring unbelievable amounts of money into a system which is not designed to share valid or correct information?

lol about ghosting 😂
Did you try GitHub Copilot, Tabnine or AWS CodeWhisperer?

Whenever I learn sth. new, it all starts with questions. I ask a variety of dif. AI models about their opinion and can fact check all the answers in a fraction of the time I used to learn. Plus I can get simplifications of complex answers and summaries and can drill deep in any direction I want to.
Why?
The human flaw is the glitch in the matrix and the spark for innovation and new creations. AI can't do this. AI is the limit.

Agree to the liability part for people who don’t understand how to use it. Their jobs will be taken by people learning to use AI. On the other hand, people who want to level up but never had access, resources or money have a powerful yet inexpensive teacher at hand.

As always it is how you use a tool, and technology as double-edged sword has a long tradition. Students using it due to laziness is the bad side. On the other side are people believing "I can ask anything, I can learn almost anything faster than before, therefore I can do pretty much anything."

"The sky is the limit" was ysd.

"The AI is the limit" is our new reality. 🌀

What do you think? 🤔

#ai #artificialintelligence

https://www.psychologytoday.com/intl/blog/the-digital-self/202307/ai-as-cognitive-partner-a-new-cognitive-age-dawns

... and if you combine that with journaling, the effect will be even higher. Great days in my journal are long+colorful (I use all the colors in journaling) paragraphs, and just looking from a distance I now how happy I was at that moment in time & that intense reflection of days also expands time 💜

Key is quality time. When you are in a place you hate, you can't wait that the day is over, and that memory will be forgotten/quickly deleted. An abundance of Q-time will occupy your mind and will be omnipresent, and radiating so vividly that it seems bigger as it actually is. ☀

Hi Katie, I agree that new things may distort the perception of space-time continuum, and #Berlin + capital cities in general serve here, b/c you always meet you people that come and go. But that is actually not the reason in my case, and I also don't think that is key for slowing down time, but ..
Looks like #summertime #Berlin 🇩🇪 😸

Life is only short when you focus on the wrong things, work in areas you dislike or hate and when you try to control things which you ultimately simply can't control.

Nowadays, when I look back to an event 3 months ago, it feels like a year ago—and not yesterday.

#life #purpose #decisions #gutfeel

3 things you learn immediately when you move to #Berlin 🇩🇪

I will talk about tools like ChatGPT, Bard, Midjourney, Jasper, Notion – these kind of tools.
https://www.paltron.com/insights-en/from-distance-to-unity-heres-how-remote-work-works-successfully
https://www.paltron.com/insights-en/remote-work-2023-pros-and-cons-in-the-modern-workplace#toc-section-2

As a freelancer, I totally get you @@760962, I also don't want to get back in an office. I think if you are young and entering the workforce, it makes sense to work at least hybrid to get that connection. Just wrote to articles about remote work:

Innovation centre, wow, I guess that won't become boring anytime! Generally, I think 4 or 3 days weeks are the future, just read somewhere (maybe even Germany) tested a 4 days week for some time and saw a higher productivity – might not work in all professions, but I am not surprised.

#Streetart in #Berlin.

Title:  Do you see the climbing man?

#wrangelkiez #xberg #naturalAntiGentrification #BerlinLovesYou #Saturday
No, definitely not. All I want to express that there is a different work attitude between generation, as there always has been.

But in this specific case –  if you don't get a job because you are too old in sb. eyes / ageism, and someone offers a job to conditions you worked your entire life to, from that older person's perception nothing much changed. And this person secured her or his livelihood.
Of course it is. This what globalization, outsourcing and all economies are built of since the beginning of time.
Can you clarify this @@33818 ?

🦋
Guten Morgen aus 🇩🇪, my dear skeeters.

#Streetart in #Berlin.

Title:  Hello Sunshine 🌞

#wrangelkiez #xberg #naturalAntiGentrification #BerlinLovesYou #TGIF

Just came across this article while writing about #microagressions in the #workplace.

Ageism is found among all ages.

https://www.rpharms.com/recognition/inclusion-diversity/microaggressions/age

This just came across in my news bubble:
https://fortune.com/2023/07/06/millennial-gen-z-employees-are-rejecting-assignments-turning-down-offers-and-seeking-purpose-they-expect-of-employers-according-to-deloittes-latest-survey/

#purpose

IT sec is hell of an interesting field, as it is constantly evolving itself, and yes, therefore hard to replace with AI.

Since it's all about creativity, I guess both sides are heavily experimenting with AI to find exploits? Is there already a dedicated security AI dealing with this?
I 💙 that Julia. What a reward to see your seedlings grow and blossom 🌸.

I get you, I was also there – now I went into the offensive, started a new YouTube channel where I will talk more about how we can leverage AI, so also others can become independent experts which are helpful to their industry

Agree, most SMEs are okay with 60-80% that AI can deliver. Now it's time to find the companies that want more than 80% or to persuade them they want more than 80% – this needs additional time and effort and mostly some sacrifices.

I see – also lost numerous clients as a copywriter since ChatGPT, but actually being a senior helps me now to show clients the limitations of AI – for example, not having its own opinion and character. But yes, you can't lean back and have to find new ways (where AI again comes handy)

I was more thinking of getting a job and being out of the game because of your age. No doubt that there are always gaps between generations – being a freelancer myself, my teach them in most cases because of my superior experience, and that does the job 4 out of 5 times. What is your experience?
as long ...

Also, Gen Z demands more from employers than any generation before (which is basically fair) – but that also means employers gratefully give the job to sb. else, who has (been brought up with) a different work attitude

1979 for the win – we are the Goats (creatives and innovators) in the Chinese zodiac, a.k.a the 'Greatest of All Times' 😆

Title: Hello Monday.

#wrangelkiez #xberg #naturalAntiGentrification #BerlinLovesYou #Monday

The way forward imho is building artists guilds. Build a team and a network by ourselve. Don't turn to the gatekeepers, their gates are busy.
Technology in the form of the internet and now AI are tools  to build your very own dedicated platform, where the community and you decide where to go.

The remaining 15% went into depression, and when finally events could happen again, AI enters the stage and smacks you right in the face. The definition of being an artist is transforming heavily, but it's also a chance. 100 years ago, that was whole different story and privilege. So what to do now?

Exactly, this is what I am talking about. Being an artist of almost any kind, became within the last few years very, very, unbelievable bad. Covid was more than a shot in the foot, many of my DJ and producer friends just vanished, flew off Berlin or were just never seen again.
Okay, who is fighting these conditions politically?

This is a worldwide problem of the creative industry. People of power misuse their position and remain as classic gatekeepers. Berlin is full of DJs and actors. The bigger clubs are running through on the weekends, but DJs are getting peanuts and also done in a few years physically and mentally.
So who is fighting for a democracy?
Okay, and there are no politicians trying to change that situation? I mean, if it affects so many people, such politicians should easily win elections ... what am I overlooking here?
Precisely @@489963 ... hope we can carry this into the near and far future!
Yep. Getreu dem Ikea Motto "Arbeitest du noch, oder lebst du schon?" 🤓
... time to get out of that situation ...
